name: NuGet
help: A .nuspec file is an XML manifest that contains package metadata. This is used both to build the package and to provide information to consumers. The manifest is always included in a package.

properties.name: Id
properties.help: The case-insensitive package identifier, which must be unique across nuget.org or whatever gallery the package will reside in. IDs may not contain spaces or characters that are not valid for a URL, and generally follow .NET namespace rules. See Choosing a unique package identifier for guidance.

properties.name: Version
properties.help: The version of the package, following the major.minor.patch pattern. Version numbers may include a pre-release suffix as described in Prerelease Packages.

properties.name: Description
properties.help: A long description of the package for UI display.

properties.name: Authors
properties.help: A comma-separated list of packages authors, matching the profile names on nuget.org. These are displayed in the NuGet Gallery on nuget.org and are used to cross-reference packages by the same authors.

properties.name: Title
properties.help: A human-friendly title of the package, typically used in UI displays as on nuget.org and the Package Manager in Visual Studio. If not specified, the package ID is used instead.

properties.name: Owners
properties.help: A comma-separated list of the package creators using profile names on nuget.org. This is often the same list as in authors, and is ignored when uploading the package to nuget.org. See Managing package owners on nuget.org.

properties.name: ProjectUrl
properties.help: A URL for the package's home page, often shown in UI displays as well as nuget.org.

properties.name: LicenseUrl
properties.help: A URL for the package's license, often shown in UI displays as well as nuget.org.

properties.name: IconUrl
properties.help: A URL for a 64x64 image with transparenty background to use as the icon for the package in UI display.

properties.name: RequireLicenseAcceptance
properties.help: A Boolean value specifying whether the client must prompt the consumer to accept the package license before installing the package.

properties.name: DevelopmentDependency
properties.help: (2.8+) A Boolean value specifying whether the package will be marked as a development-only-dependency, which prevents the package from being included as a dependency in other packages.

properties.name: Summary
properties.help: A short description of the package for UI display. If omitted, a truncated version of the <see cref="NuGetPackage.Description"/> is used.

properties.name: ReleaseNotes
properties.help: (1.5+) A description of the changes made in this release of the package, often used in UI like the Updates tab of the Visual Studio Package Manager in place of the package description.

properties.name: Language
properties.help: The locale ID for the package. See Creating localized packages.

properties.name: Tags
properties.help: A space-delimited list of tags and keywords that describe the package and aid discoverability of packages through search and filtering mechanisms.

properties.name: ContentFiles
properties.help: (3.3+) A collection of <files> elements that identify content files that should be include in the consuming project. These files are specified with a set of attributes that describe how they should be used within the project system. See Specifying files to include in the package.

properties.name: DependencySets
properties.help: A collection of zero or more <dependency> elements specifying the dependencies for the package. Each dependency has attributes of id, version, include (3.x+), and exclude (3.x+). See Dependencies.
